author: sussman
msg: * libsvn_wc: add translate-test to svn:ignore prop

author: kfogel
msg: Move keyword stuff from libsvn_io to libsvn_wc.
Also, handle the edge case whereby setting the svn:keywords property
on a file that doesn't have the prop, but which does contain keyword
strings, implies a backhanded local mod on the file, since it will now
differ from its text-base at commit time.  We have to invalidate the
timestamp for the local mod to be detected correctly.  Worked with
This passes "make check", but whether or not it actually fixes the
abovementioned case has not yet been verified.  Committing first
because others are waiting for the update.
svn_io_copy_and_translate): Moved to svn_wc.h and renamed, see below.
svn_wc_copy_and_translate): Received from svn_io.h and renamed, see
translate_newline): Moved to new file libsvn_wc/translate.c.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/props.c: Remove some whitespace acreage from
near the end of the file.
advantage of new parameter to expand_keyword.  Don't allocate a
keyword structure unless we absolutely have to.  Doc fixes.
(svn_wc_prop_set): If setting a translation property, possibly
(setup_working_copy): Set up more files.  Doc tweak.

author: cmpilato
msg: (close_file): If the "new value" we got from the repository is NULL,
then we are removing the keywords property, meaning we are
effectively turning off keyword support...so just set keywords to
NULL.  Also, pass '-f' to `patch` so it never asks the user
questions such as "Reversed (or previously applied) patch detected!

author: sussman
msg: Bugfix:  we were placing eol literals like "\n" into our xml log commands.
Unfortunately, expat parses them all into a space, and we were ending up
with translated working copy files that had no eol's at all, just spaces!
* get_editor.c (close_file): once we decide on a value of eol_str,
use new routine to re-encode it (for burying in xml)
* log.c (log_do_file_xfer): parse the xml eol encoding into a real eol
string, using the same parser that is used when parsing the value of
